trans-unit.source: Converts a <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys"></xref> object to and from other types.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeysConverter> converts to and from a <xref:System.String> using the "+" character as the delimiter.

For example, the string `Control+ALT` would be converted into a <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> object consisting of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys.Control> and <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys.Alt> keys.
This behavior differs from the default XAML parser-level enumeration combine character of ",".
XAML Text Usage
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeysConverter"></xref> class.
Determines whether an object of the specified type can be converted to an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys"></xref>, using the specified context.
A format context that provides information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
The type being evaluated for conversion.
`true` if sourceType is type ; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether an instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys"></xref> can be converted to the specified type, using the specified context.
A format context that provides information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
The type being evaluated for conversion.
`true` if destinationType is type ; otherwise, `false`.
Attempts to convert the specified object to a <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys"></xref>, using the specified context.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeysConverter> converts to and from a <xref:System.String> using the "+" key as the delimiter.

For example, the string `Control+ALT` would be converted into a <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> consisting of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys.Control> and <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys.Alt> keys.
A format context that provides information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
Culture specific information.
The object to convert.
The converted object.
source cannot be converted.
Attempts to convert a <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys"></xref> to the specified type, using the specified context.
`destinationType` must be <xref:System.String>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeysConverter> converts to and from a <xref:System.String> using the "+" key as the delimiter.

For example, the string `Control+ALT` would be converted into a <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys> consisting of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys.Control> and <xref:System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys.Alt> keys.
A format context that provides information about the environment from which this converter is being invoked.
Culture specific information.
The object to convert.
The type to convert the object to.
The converted object.
destinationType is `null`.
value does not map to a valid .
value cannot be converted.
Determines whether the specified value is a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys"></xref> value.
The value to check for validity.
`true` if input is a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Input.ModifierKeys"></xref> value; otherwise, `false`.
